alert.note: Alert for Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 12:07PM CDT until May 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell, Claiborne and Union. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Follette, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Harrogate, Arthur, Springdale, Cumberland Gap, Powell River Preserve, Ewing and Fincastle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
